comments:
(3.2 Release)
Test case:
1) Create a path variable ZZZ pointing to, say, c:\temp
2) Create a project "p1"
3) Create a linked folder in p1, by selecting the ZZZ variable in the "Select Path Variable" dialog and setting "ZZZ" as the linked folder name.
4) Create a subfolder in ZZZ
5) Close p1 // this is required prior to deleting the project to reproduce the bug
6) Delete p1
7) Create a project "p2"
8) Try to repeat the step 3 for "p2" (link the same folder pointed to by the "ZZZ" variable). An error dialog pops up: "Internal error: Element not found: /p1/ZZZ" (that is, the one residing in the project we deleted in the step 6.), the folder creation dialog is not closed, and the following exception is logged:

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Element not found: /p1/ZZZ.
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTree.elementNotFound(ElementTree.java:255)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTree.createElement(ElementTree.java:183)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.createResource(Workspace.java:797)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.createResource(Workspace.java:754)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.RefreshLocalVisitor.createResource(RefreshLocalVisitor.java:82)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.RefreshLocalAliasVisitor.createResource(RefreshLocalAliasVisitor.java:37)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.RefreshLocalVisitor.synchronizeExistence(RefreshLocalVisitor.java:218)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.RefreshLocalVisitor.visit(RefreshLocalVisitor.java:290)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.UnifiedTree.accept(UnifiedTree.java:93)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.FileSystemResourceManager.refreshResource(FileSystemResourceManager.java:726)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.FileSystemResourceManager.refresh(FileSystemResourceManager.java:710)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.refreshLocal(Resource.java:1400)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.createLink(Resource.java:610)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.createLink(Resource.java:570)
	at org.eclipse.ui.dialogs.WizardNewFolderMainPage.createFolder(WizardNewFolderMainPage.java:209)
	at org.eclipse.ui.dialogs.WizardNewFolderMainPage$4.execute(WizardNewFolderMainPage.java:311)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation$1.run(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:101)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1737)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation.run(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:113)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)

Thanks for the report with such detailed steps to reproduce.  However, it turns out that this bug has already been fixed in the 3.3 stream.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 144458 ***
*** Bug 189856 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
